comments.body: I guess you are trying to enforce `to` to be a required property if the `options` is provided, however the optional parameter here ignores that requirement, and TypeScript do not differentiate signatures just via return types. Removing the `options?` here might work

No, I'm just trying to enforce that if `{to: 'string'}` is present, the return type is 'string'. [Playground link](http://www.typescriptlang.org/play/index.html#src=declare%20namespace%20Foo%20%7B%0D%0A%20%20%20%20interface%20Data%20%7B%20%7D%0D%0A%20%20%20%20interface%20DeflateOptions%20%7B%20%7D%0D%0A%20%20%20%20export%20function%20deflate(data%3A%20Data%2C%20options%3A%20DeflateOptions%20%26%20%7B%20to%3A%20'string'%20%7D)%3A%20string%3B%0D%0A%20%20%20%20export%20function%20deflate(data%3A%20Data%2C%20options%3F%3A%20DeflateOptions)%3A%20Uint8Array%3B%0D%0A%7D%0D%0A%0D%0Alet%20a%3A%20Uint8Array%20%3D%20Foo.deflate('a')%3B%0D%0Alet%20a2%3A%20Uint8Array%20%3D%20Foo.deflate('a'%2C%20%7B%20stuff%3A%20true%20%7D)%3B%0D%0Alet%20s%3A%20string%20%3D%20Foo.deflate('a'%2C%20%7B%20to%3A%20'string'%20%7D)%3B)
